intro: Fagelia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy fagelia, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants known for their toxic properties. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are typically oval-shaped with a rough texture. Its small, yellowish flowers are followed by red, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation in tropical environments.
